title: الإِغْرَاء وَالتَّحْذِير
description: Learn about الإغراء (encouragement) and التحذير (warning), two rhetorical styles using accusative nouns to urge toward good or warn against evil.

notes.title: What is الإِغْرَاء?
content: الإغراء is a grammatical construction used to encourage someone toward a praiseworthy action or quality. It involves mentioning an accusative noun (منصوب) urging the listener to adhere to it.

The encouraged noun is مفعول به (direct object) for an omitted verb like اِلْزَمْ (adhere to). This verb is obligatorily deleted when the noun is repeated or conjoined, and optionally deleted otherwise.
keyPoints: Omitted verb is typically اِلْزَمْ or الْزَمُوا
Verb deletion is obligatory with repetition or عطف

notes.title: What is التَّحْذِير?
content: التحذير is a grammatical construction used to warn someone against a blameworthy action or danger. Like الإغراء, it uses an accusative noun but for the opposite purpose: to make someone avoid something.
The warned-against noun is also مفعول به for an omitted verb like اِحْذَرْ (beware of) or اِجْتَنِبْ (avoid). The expression إِيَّاكَ is specifically used for warning.
keyPoints: Omitted verb is typically اِحْذَرْ or اِجْتَنِبْ
إِيَّاكَ is a special warning pronoun

notes.title: The Construction with إِيَّاكَ
content: The pronoun إِيَّاكَ (and its conjugations: إِيَّاكِ، إِيَّاكُمَا، إِيَّاكُمْ، إِيَّاكُنَّ) is specifically used for warning. It is a separated object pronoun (ضمير منفصل في محل نصب).
When used with وَ (and), the warned-against noun is conjoined: إِيَّاكَ وَالْكَذِبَ. Without وَ, the noun can come directly: إِيَّاكَ الْكَذِبَ. Both constructions are valid.
keyPoints: إِيَّاكَ: ضمير منفصل مبني في محل نصب مفعول به
The وَ is عطف connecting two warned-against things
Conjugates for gender and number: إِيَّاكِ، إِيَّاكُمْ
Verb is obligatorily deleted with إِيَّاكَ

notes.title: Grammatical Parsing and Quranic Examples
content: In both الإغراء and التحذير, the noun is منصوب as مفعول به لفعل محذوف وجوبًا أو جوازًا (object of an obligatorily or optionally deleted verb).
The Quran and Hadith contain examples of التحذير. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: إِيَّاكُمْ وَالظَّنَّ (Beware of suspicion). This shows the classical use of this construction.
keyPoints: The noun is مفعول به لفعل محذوف
Deletion is وجوبًا with repetition, عطف, or إِيَّاكَ
Deletion is جوازًا with single unrepeated noun
Common in Hadith literature and classical texts
